frame.name: Finish_competition
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Competition</fen> comes to an end, with a <fen>Competitor</fen> tying, winning, or losing against an <fen>Opponent</fen> (or opponents) according to their <fen>Score</fen>. (In the symmetrical situation of a tie, the <fen>Competitor</fen> and <fen>Opponent</fen> may be jointly mentioned as <fen>Competitors</fen>.) According to the <fen>Score</fen> that the <fen>Competitor</fen> and <fen>Opponent</fen> have achieved, they may receive a <fen>Rank</fen> or a <fen>Prize</fen>. The <fen>Margin</fen> may also be mentioned.
<ex>Unbelievable--<fex name="Competitor">he</fex> <t>lost</t> <fex name="Prize">the gold medal</fex> <fex name="Margin">by just .02 points</fex>!</ex> <ex>Looks like it will came to a <t>draw</t> <fex name="Competitors">between Woods and Stephenson</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Opponent
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual that the <fen>Competitor</fen> has been competing against.</def-root>

FE.name: Competitors
FE.definition: <def-root>The individuals who compete against each other.</def-root>

FE.name: Score
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity whereby progress is measured during the game, and Rank and <fen>Prize</fen>s are awarded to the <fen>Competitors</fen> afterward.</def-root>

FE.name: Margin
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount by which the <fen>Competitor</fen> 's and <fen>Opponent</fen> 's <fen>Score</fen>s differ.</def-root>

FE.name: Prize
FE.definition: <def-root>A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a <fen>Competitor</fen> according to <fen>Score</fen> or <fen>Rank</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Competition
FE.definition: <def-root>The event in which the <fen>Competitors</fen> compete with each other.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Competitor</fen> that results in the outcome of the <fen>Competition</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Competition</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Competitor</fen> that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Venue
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition. <ex>The Mets <t>won</t> against the Yankees <fex name="Venue">at Shea Stadium</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: zege.n
lexUnit.definition: van iemand op iets of iemand

lexUnit.name: overwinning.n
lexUnit.definition: dat je in een wedstrijd of spel van iemand wint
